trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Capture Role</languageKeyword> operation creates a copy of the operating system virtual hard disk (VHD) that is associated with the Virtual Machine, saves the VHD copy in the same storage location as the operating system VHD, and registers the copy as an image the image repository.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Capture Role</languageKeyword> operation creates a copy of the operating system virtual hard disk (VHD) that is associated with the Virtual Machine, saves the VHD copy in the same storage location as the operating system VHD, and registers the copy as an image the image repository.

trans-unit.source: You must prepare the Virtual Machine by running the Sysprep command and you must shut down the Virtual Machine before you can capture an image from it.
trans-unit.target: You must prepare the Virtual Machine by running the Sysprep command and you must shut down the Virtual Machine before you can capture an image from it.

trans-unit.source: You can shut down the virtual machine by using the Management Portal, by using the <externalLink><linkText>Stop-AzureVM</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj152831.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet, or by using <externalLink><linkText>Shutdown Role</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj157195.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: You can shut down the virtual machine by using the Management Portal, by using the <externalLink><linkText>Stop-AzureVM</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj152831.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet, or by using <externalLink><linkText>Shutdown Role</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj157195.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: From the captured image, you can create additional Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: From the captured image, you can create additional Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: For more information about images and disks, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c8389c97-1220-424c-b179-4ee197d7aee5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Disks and Images in Azure</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about images and disks, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c8389c97-1220-424c-b179-4ee197d7aee5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Disks and Images in Azure</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about capturing images, see <externalLink><linkText>How to Capture an Image of a Virtual Machine Running Linux</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/manage/linux/how-to-guides/capture-an-image/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about capturing images, see <externalLink><linkText>How to Capture an Image of a Virtual Machine Running Linux</linkText><linkUri>http://www.windowsazure.com/manage/linux/how-to-guides/capture-an-image/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Capture Role</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Capture Role</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloudservice-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the cloud service, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;deployment-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the deployment, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;role-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloudservice-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the cloud service, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;deployment-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the deployment, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;role-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.

trans-unit.source: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the request headers.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: This header should be set to <userInput>2012-03-01</userInput> or higher.
trans-unit.target: This header should be set to <userInput>2012-03-01</userInput> or higher.

trans-unit.source: For more information about versioning headers, see <externalLink><linkText>Service Management Versioning</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/gg592580.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about versioning headers, see <externalLink><linkText>Service Management Versioning</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/gg592580.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows the format of the request body:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows the format of the request body:

trans-unit.source: The following example shows the format of the request body to capture a Linux Virtual Machine:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows the format of the request body to capture a Linux Virtual Machine:

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements of the request body.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements of the request body.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the action that is performed after the capture operation finishes.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the action that is performed after the capture operation finishes.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Delete</languageKeyword> – this value causes the virtual machine to be deleted after the image has been captured.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Delete</languageKeyword> – this value causes the virtual machine to be deleted after the image has been captured.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>Reprovision</languageKeyword> – this value causes the virtual machine to be redeployed after the image is captured by using the specified information in <languageKeyword>ProvisioningConfiguration</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>Reprovision</languageKeyword> – this value causes the virtual machine to be redeployed after the image is captured by using the specified information in <languageKeyword>ProvisioningConfiguration</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Contains information that is used to redeploy a Virtual Machine after an image has been captured.
trans-unit.target: Contains information that is used to redeploy a Virtual Machine after an image has been captured.

trans-unit.source: This element is only used when the <languageKeyword>PostCaptureAction</languageKeyword> is set to <languageKeyword>Reprovision</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: This element is only used when the <languageKeyword>PostCaptureAction</languageKeyword> is set to <languageKeyword>Reprovision</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the description of the captured image.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the description of the captured image.

trans-unit.source: The value of this element is only obtained programmatically and does not appear in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: The value of this element is only obtained programmatically and does not appear in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the captured image.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the captured image.

trans-unit.source: Contains information that is used to redeploy a Virtual Machine after an image has been captured.
trans-unit.target: Contains information that is used to redeploy a Virtual Machine after an image has been captured.

trans-unit.source: To provision a new Virtual Machine, you must specify one of the following configuration sets:
trans-unit.target: To provision a new Virtual Machine, you must specify one of the following configuration sets:

trans-unit.source: Specifies the computer name for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the computer name for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: If you do not specify a computer name, one is assigned that is a combination of the deployment name, role name, and identifying number.
trans-unit.target: If you do not specify a computer name, one is assigned that is a combination of the deployment name, role name, and identifying number.

trans-unit.source: Computer names must be 1 to 15 characters long.
trans-unit.target: Computer names must be 1 to 15 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the base-64-encoded string that contains the administrator password to use for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the base-64-encoded string that contains the administrator password to use for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether automatic updates are enabled for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether automatic updates are enabled for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the time zone for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the time zone for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: For a complete list of supported time zone entries, you can:
trans-unit.target: For a complete list of supported time zone entries, you can:

trans-unit.source: Refer to the values listed in the registry entry <codeEntityReference>HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Time Zones</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the values listed in the registry entry <codeEntityReference>HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Time Zones</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: You can use the tzutil command-line tool to list the valid time.
trans-unit.target: You can use the tzutil command-line tool to list the valid time.

trans-unit.source: Contains properties that define a domain to which the Virtual Machine will be joined.
trans-unit.target: Contains properties that define a domain to which the Virtual Machine will be joined.

trans-unit.source: Contains a list of service certificates with which to provision to the new Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a list of service certificates with which to provision to the new Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Contains configuration settings for the Windows Remote Management service on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains configuration settings for the Windows Remote Management service on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the default administrator account.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the default administrator account.

trans-unit.source: This is a required parameter after version 2013-03-01.
trans-unit.target: This is a required parameter after version 2013-03-01.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a base-64 encoded string of custom data.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a base-64 encoded string of custom data.

trans-unit.source: The base-64 encoded string is decoded to a binary array that is saved as a file on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: The base-64 encoded string is decoded to a binary array that is saved as a file on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes.
trans-unit.target: The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes.

trans-unit.source: If the file exists, it is overwritten.
trans-unit.target: If the file exists, it is overwritten.

trans-unit.source: The security on directory is set to System:Full Control and Administrators:Full Control.
trans-unit.target: The security on directory is set to System:Full Control and Administrators:Full Control.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>CustomData</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-10-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>CustomData</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-10-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies additional base-64 encoded XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file, which is used by Windows Setup.
trans-unit.target: Specifies additional base-64 encoded XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file, which is used by Windows Setup.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>AdditionalUnattendContent</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-04-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>AdditionalUnattendContent</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-04-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the host name for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the host name for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Host names must be 1 to 64 characters long.
trans-unit.target: Host names must be 1 to 64 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of a user account to be created in the sudoer group of the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of a user account to be created in the sudoer group of the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: User account names must be 1 to 32 characters long.
trans-unit.target: User account names must be 1 to 32 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the password for the user account.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the password for the user account.

trans-unit.source: Passwords must be 6 to 72 characters long.
trans-unit.target: Passwords must be 6 to 72 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether SSH password authentication is disabled.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether SSH password authentication is disabled.

trans-unit.source: By default this value is set to true.
trans-unit.target: By default this value is set to true.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the SSH public keys and key pairs to use with the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the SSH public keys and key pairs to use with the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a base-64 encoded string of custom data.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a base-64 encoded string of custom data.

trans-unit.source: The base-64 encoded string is located in the ovf-env.xml file on the ISO of the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: The base-64 encoded string is located in the ovf-env.xml file on the ISO of the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: The file is copied to /var/lib/waagent/ovf-env.xml by the Azure Linux Agent.
trans-unit.target: The file is copied to /var/lib/waagent/ovf-env.xml by the Azure Linux Agent.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Linux Agent will also place the base-64 encoded data in /var/lib/waagent/CustomData during provisioning.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Linux Agent will also place the base-64 encoded data in /var/lib/waagent/CustomData during provisioning.

trans-unit.source: The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes.
trans-unit.target: The maximum length of the binary array is 65535 bytes.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>CustomData</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-10-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>CustomData</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-10-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Contains properties that define a domain to which the Virtual Machine will be joined.
trans-unit.target: Contains properties that define a domain to which the Virtual Machine will be joined.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the credentials to use to join the Virtual Machine to the domain.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the credentials to use to join the Virtual Machine to the domain.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) X 500-distinguished name of the organizational unit (OU) in which the computer account is created.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) X 500-distinguished name of the organizational unit (OU) in which the computer account is created.

trans-unit.source: This account is in Active Directory on a domain controller in the domain to which the computer is being joined.
trans-unit.target: This account is in Active Directory on a domain controller in the domain to which the computer is being joined.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the credentials to use to join the Virtual Machine to the domain.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the credentials to use to join the Virtual Machine to the domain.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the domain used to authenticate an account.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the domain used to authenticate an account.

trans-unit.source: The value is a fully qualified DNS domain.
trans-unit.target: The value is a fully qualified DNS domain.

trans-unit.source: If the domains name is not specified, <languageKeyword>Username</languageKeyword> must specify the user principal name (UPN) format (user@fully-qualified-DNS-domain) or the fully-qualified-DNS-domain\username format.
trans-unit.target: If the domains name is not specified, <languageKeyword>Username</languageKeyword> must specify the user principal name (UPN) format (user@fully-qualified-DNS-domain) or the fully-qualified-DNS-domain\username format.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a user name in the domain that can be used to join the domain.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a user name in the domain that can be used to join the domain.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the password to use to join the domain.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the password to use to join the domain.

trans-unit.source: Contains a list of service certificates with which to provision to the new Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a list of service certificates with which to provision to the new Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Stored certificate settings reference certificates that already exist in the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Stored certificate settings reference certificates that already exist in the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: Before you configure the stored certificates for the Virtual Machine, you must call the <link xlink:href="eb4313c8-19b7-4966-912b-eced07a0e36e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add Service Certificate</link> operation or add the certificate by using the Management portal.
trans-unit.target: Before you configure the stored certificates for the Virtual Machine, you must call the <link xlink:href="eb4313c8-19b7-4966-912b-eced07a0e36e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add Service Certificate</link> operation or add the certificate by using the Management portal.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the parameters for the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the parameters for the certificate.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the certificate store location on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the certificate store location on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the certificate store from which the certificate is retrieved.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the certificate store from which the certificate is retrieved.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the thumbprint of the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the thumbprint of the certificate.

trans-unit.source: The thumbprint must specify an existing service certificate.
trans-unit.target: The thumbprint must specify an existing service certificate.

trans-unit.source: Contains configuration settings for the Windows Remote Management service on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains configuration settings for the Windows Remote Management service on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of information for enabling remote Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of information for enabling remote Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the protocol and certificate information for the listener.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the protocol and certificate information for the listener.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the certificate thumbprint for the secure connection.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the certificate thumbprint for the secure connection.

trans-unit.source: If this value is not specified, a self-signed certificate is generated and used for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: If this value is not specified, a self-signed certificate is generated and used for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies additional base-64 encoded XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file, which is used by Windows Setup.
trans-unit.target: Specifies additional base-64 encoded XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file, which is used by Windows Setup.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the pass that the content applies to.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the pass that the content applies to.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the component to configure with the added content.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the component to configure with the added content.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the setting to which the content applies.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the setting to which the content applies.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the base-64 encoded XML formatted content that is added to the unattend.xml file for the specified path and component.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the base-64 encoded XML formatted content that is added to the unattend.xml file for the specified path and component.

trans-unit.source: The XML must be less that 4 KB and must include the root element for the setting or feature that is being inserted.
trans-unit.target: The XML must be less that 4 KB and must include the root element for the setting or feature that is being inserted.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the SSH public keys and key pairs to use with the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the SSH public keys and key pairs to use with the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the collection of SSH public keys.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the collection of SSH public keys.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the SHA1 fingerprint of an X509 certificate associated with the hosted service that includes the SSH public key.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the SHA1 fingerprint of an X509 certificate associated with the hosted service that includes the SSH public key.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the full path of a file, on the Virtual Machine, where the SSH public key is stored.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the full path of a file, on the Virtual Machine, where the SSH public key is stored.

trans-unit.source: If the file already exists, the specified key is appended to the file.
trans-unit.target: If the file already exists, the specified key is appended to the file.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of SSH key pairs.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of SSH key pairs.

trans-unit.source: Contains an SSH key pair to be installed on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains an SSH key pair to be installed on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the SHA1 fingerprint of an X509 certificate that is associated with the cloud service and includes the SSH keypair.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the SHA1 fingerprint of an X509 certificate that is associated with the cloud service and includes the SSH keypair.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the full path of a file, on the virtual machine, which stores the SSH private key.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the full path of a file, on the virtual machine, which stores the SSH private key.

trans-unit.source: The file is overwritten when multiple keys are written to it.
trans-unit.target: The file is overwritten when multiple keys are written to it.

trans-unit.source: The SSH public key is stored in the same directory and has the same name as the private key file with .pub suffix.
trans-unit.target: The SSH public key is stored in the same directory and has the same name as the private key file with .pub suffix.

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 202 (Accepted).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 202 (Accepted).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.
trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.

trans-unit.source: The image that is captured from the Virtual Machine is located in the same storage account its operating system disk.
trans-unit.target: The image that is captured from the Virtual Machine is located in the same storage account its operating system disk.

trans-unit.source: You can find the name of the storage account by looking at the Disks section of the dashboard for the Virtual Machine in the Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: You can find the name of the storage account by looking at the Disks section of the dashboard for the Virtual Machine in the Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the following resources to capture an image of a Virtual Machine:
trans-unit.target: You can also use the following resources to capture an image of a Virtual Machine:

trans-unit.source: Capture an image of a running virtual machine
trans-unit.target: Capture an image of a running virtual machine
